content.description:
Traverse in from the north, use a paddle board to reach the problem, or traverse in from the south. The north traverse is a bit more pumpy.

Start of the problem is a fist jam in a shelf about chest high. Use your skills to reach a bomber jam up and to the left. Mantle over and wipe the sweat off your brow.

The water underneath is clear to fall, meaning that you can blow the mantle move and not worry about hitting anything in the water.
content.location: The problem is located on the face of rock that is popular for cliff jumping into the lake and so if you’re wondering if you’re in the right spot, you most likely are.

content.description: Underneath the final pitch of ccc falls ice there is a large Boulder that is cleaved in half. Probably not accessible when the river is not frozen. Super easy chimney you can do in your ice boots but do it for the pics.
content.location: Follow the ccc trail up to just before the final pitch of the falls or if the falls are in climb the first two pitches and stop at the Boulder on your way up river to the final pitch.
